unnormalised: Okay, here's a Quora post on rental agreements, keeping in mind all your requests:
normalised: rental agreements something to be serious about, boss!

unnormalised: **Rental Agreements: Kuch toh serious hona chahiye, boss!**
normalised: so, you're renting out your flat in Mumbai or maybe looking to rent a place near I I T Delhi? before you hand over those rupee twenty thousand security deposit and get excited about your independence (or passive income!), let's talk about rental agreements.

unnormalised: So, you're renting out your flat in Mumbai or maybe looking to rent a place near IIT Delhi? Before you hand over those *Rs. 20,000 security deposit* and get excited about your independence (or passive income!), let's talk about rental agreements.
normalised: seriously, people, don't take these lightly. I've seen too many friends get burned because they just "trusted" the landlord slash tenant. a proper rental agreement is your ram-baan (ultimate solution) in case things go south.

unnormalised: Seriously, people, don't take these lightly. I've seen too many friends get burned because they just "trusted" the landlord/tenant. A proper rental agreement is your *Ram-Baan* (ultimate solution) in case things go south.
normalised: it should clearly state the rent amount, due date, late payment penalties (don't be shy!), and the lock-in period. what happens if you need to move out before, say, eleven months? this needs to be clear!

unnormalised: It should clearly state the rent amount, due date, late payment penalties (don't be shy!), and the lock-in period. What happens if you need to move out before, say, 11 months? This needs to be clear!
normalised: also, what about maintenance charges? is it your responsibility to fix the leaky tap or is that the landlord's problem? spell it out!

unnormalised: Also, what about maintenance charges? Is it your responsibility to fix the leaky tap or is that the landlord's problem? Spell it out!
normalised: and while you're enjoying your first home-cooked biryani in your new place, remember to read the fine print. are pets allowed? can you sublet? what about painting the walls a different colour (thinking of a festive Onam mural, maybe?)?

unnormalised: And while you're enjoying your first home-cooked *biryani* in your new place, remember to read the fine print. Are pets allowed? Can you sublet? What about painting the walls a different colour (thinking of a festive Onam mural, maybe?)?
normalised: remember, a well-drafted rental agreement can save you a lot of headaches and bakwaas later. get it notarized too, especially in cities like Bangalore where things can get tricky. don't rely on just a handshake and 'chalta hai' attitude. protect yourself!

unnormalised: Remember, a well-drafted rental agreement can save you a lot of headaches and *bakwaas* later. Get it notarized too, especially in cities like Bangalore where things can get tricky. Don't rely on just a handshake and *'chalta hai'* attitude. Protect yourself!
